title: [improvement](catalog) Escape characters for columns in recovery predicate pushdown in SQL
body:
## Proposed changes

Issue Number: close #xxx

In the previous logic, when we restored the Column in the predicate pushdown based on the logical syntax tree for JdbcScanNode, in order to avoid query errors caused by keywords such as `key`, we added escape characters for it, but before we only Binary predicates are processed, which is imperfect. We should add escape characters to all columns that appear in the predicate to avoid errors with keywords or illegal characters.

## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

title: [Fix](schema change) fix the bug that non light schema change tables can rename column
body:
## How to reproduce the problem
1 crate table in 1.1
2 Upgrade to version 1.2
3 rename column
4 select * from table，Report an error.

## reason
Tables disable light schema change are not allowed to perform column rename. However, when upgrading from 1.1 to 1.2, maxColUniqueId will be initialized to 0, resulting in invalid judgment

title: [bug](bitmap) should return error status when execute failed
body:
## Proposed changes
because it's not return error status, it's will be coredump in follow steps.
```
mysql [(none)]>select bitmap_from_base64("aGVsbG9fd29ybGQ=");
ERROR 1105 (HY000): RpcException, msg: io.grpc.StatusRuntimeException: UNAVAILABLE: Network closed for unknown reason
```

if return error status, the query could be cancelled rather than code dump
```
mysql [(none)]>select bitmap_from_base64("aGVsbG9fd29ybGQ=");
ERROR 1105 (HY000): errCode = 2, detailMessage = (10.16.10.8)[CANCELLED]bitmap_from_base64 decode failed: base64: aGVsbG9fd29ybGQ=
```

Issue Number: close #xxx

It's not guaranteed that the upstream will send data constantly (may limited by back pressure).
In this case, downstream should not close the stream too early, so we set idle timeout equal to load timeout.

title: [feature](function) support ip functions named to_ipv4[or_default, or_null](string) and to_ipv6[or_default, or_null](string)
body:
## Proposed changes

Issue Number: close #20584

<!--Describe your changes.-->
- `to_ipv4`:  A function like `ipv4_string_to_num` that takes a string form of IPv4 address and returns value of IPv4 type, which is binary equal to value returned by `ipv4_string_to_num`. If the IPv4 address has an invalid format, throw an exception. 
- `to_ipv4_or_default`: Same as `to_ipv4`, but if the IPv4 address has an invalid format, it returns 0.0.0.0 (0 IPv4).
- `to_ipv4_or_null`: Same as `to_ipv4`, but if the IPv4 address has an invalid format, it returns null.
- `to_ipv6`: Converts a string form of IPv6 address to IPv6 type. If the IPv6 address has an invalid format, throw an exception. Similar to `ipv6_string_to_num` function, which converts IPv6 address to binary format.
- `to_ipv6_or_default`: Same as `to_ipv6`, but if the IPv6 address has an invalid format, it returns :: (0 IPv6).
- `to_ipv6_or_null`: Same as `to_ipv6`, but if the IPv6 address has an invalid format, it returns null.

## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

title: [Fix](nereids) Fix cte rewrite by mv failure and predicates compensation by mistake
body:
## Proposed changes

**Fix cte rewrite by mv wrongly when query has scalar aggregate but view no**
For example as following, it should not be rewritten by materialized view successfully
>  // materialzied view define
>    def mv20_1 = """
>            select
>            l_shipmode,
>            l_shipinstruct,
>            sum(l_extendedprice),
>            count(*)
>            from lineitem
>            left join
>            orders on lineitem.L_ORDERKEY = orders.O_ORDERKEY
>            group by 
>            l_shipmode,
>           l_shipinstruct;
>    """
>   // query sql
>   def query20_1 =
>            """
>            select
>            sum(l_extendedprice),
>           count(*)
>            from lineitem
>            left join
>            orders
>           on lineitem.L_ORDERKEY = orders.O_ORDERKEY
>   """

**Fix predicates compensation by mistake**
For example as following, it can return right result, but it's wrong earlier.
>    // materialzied view define
>    def mv7_1 = """
>        select l_shipdate, o_orderdate, l_partkey, l_suppkey
>        from lineitem
>         left join orders
>         on lineitem.l_orderkey = orders.o_orderkey
>         where l_shipdate = '2023-12-08' and o_orderdate = '2023-12-08';
>     """
>     // query sql
>     def query7_1 = """
 >        select l_shipdate, o_orderdate, l_partkey, l_suppkey
 >        from (select * from lineitem where l_shipdate = '2023-10-17' ) t1
 >        left join orders
 >        on t1.l_orderkey = orders.o_orderkey;
 >    """

and optimize some code usage and add more comment for method


## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

title: [Optimize](kill-query)Support the scanners exits as soon as possible when kill query
body:
## Proposed changes

Issue Number: close #xxx

<!--Describe your changes.-->
I created a catalog for Iceberg table, sent a query that executed for a long time, and the CPU usage is up to 100%, then I killed this query but found CPU usage did not reduce and there were still many _scanner_scan threads alive on BE.

This is because if the reader in the scanner reads no rows, scanner will not return _get_block_imp function.

This PR is help scanners exit as soon as possible when query is killed.

## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

body:
## Proposed changes

There are some periodic reports during the load process, and the reports from the intermediate process may be concurrent with the last report. The last report causes the counter to decrease to zero, but it is possible that the report without commit-info triggered the commit operation, resulting in the data not being published.

title: [community](tool) add a tool to pick pr from one branch to another
body:
## Proposed changes

A tool to pick pr from one branch to another.

```
usage: tools/pick_pr.sh <branch_from> <branch_to> <git_push_remote> <pr_number>

       branch_from/to  syntax: local_git_remote_name/branch_name  eg: upstream/master upstream/branch-2.0
       git_push_remote syntax: local_git_remote_name              eg: origin your_name
       use 'git remote -v' to get list of local_git_remote_name

       NOTICE: This script depends on github cli tool 'gh', which can be get from https://cli.github.com/
               You need to login using 'gh auth login'. It will ask your github token, which can be generated at https://github.com/settings/tokens
```

The tool will show the commit for the pr and wait user's confirmation. Here is an example.

```
$ sh tools/pick_pr.sh apache/master apache/branch-2.0 origin 29391
step1: git fetch to update local git repos apache and apache

step2: get pr 29391 commit id using gh cli
commit id for 29391 is 'c1ddcc5751f92a32c522aeb86055fe0b23ecbaf9'
commit c1ddcc5751f92a32c522aeb86055fe0b23ecbaf9
Author: Mingyu Chen <[morningman@163.com](mailto:morningman@163.com)>
Date:   Fri Jan 5 00:14:16 2024 +0800

    [opt](config) create custom conf dir if not exists (#29391)

 fe/fe-common/src/main/java/org/apache/doris/common/ConfigBase.java | 1 +
 1 file changed, 1 insertion(+)

step3: create local branch  based on remote branch apache/branch-2.0
switched to new branch 'pick_29391_to_apache_branch-2.0'

step4: will run git cherry-pick c1ddcc5751f92a32c522aeb86055fe0b23ecbaf9 , please confirm y/n: y

auto merged fe/fe-common/src/main/java/org/apache/doris/common/ConfigBase.java
[pick_29391_to_apache_branch-2.0 111c4c49e8] [opt](config) create custom conf dir if not exists (#29391)
 Author: Mingyu Chen <[morningman@163.com](mailto:morningman@163.com)>
 Date: Fri Jan 5 00:14:16 2024 +0800
 1 file changed, 1 insertion(+)

step5: push to your remote repo origin [git@github.com:](mailto:git@github.com:)xiaokang/doris.git
remote: Resolving deltas: 100% (3434/3434), completed with 801 local objects.
remote: 
remote: Create a pull request for 'pick_29391_to_apache_branch-2.0' on GitHub by visiting:
remote:      https://github.com/xiaokang/doris/pull/new/pick_29391_to_apache_branch-2.0
remote: 
To [github.com:](http://github.com/)xiaokang/doris.git
 * [new branch]            pick_29391_to_apache_branch-2.0 -> pick_29391_to_apache_branch-2.0

step6: create pr using gh cli
new pr url: https://github.com/apache/doris/pull/29763

step7: comment 'run buildall' to trigger tests using gh cli
https://github.com/apache/doris/pull/29763#issuecomment-1884091459
```



## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...
